description: {beacon} Energy & Environment Energy & Environment   The Big Story  Trump wants to cut environmental reviews for space industry President Trump signed an executive order Wednesday easing regulations for commercial rocket launches and spaceport development, in a move likely to boost Elon Musk’s SpaceX.  © Alex Brandon, Associated Press file The order calls for eliminating or expediting...
title: Trump easing environmental rules for space companies

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) reportedly left the city on Thursday amid President Trump’s decision to bring in the National Guard amid his crackdown on crime in the District. Bowser is visiting Martha’s Vineyard for a family commitment and is set to return to D.C. on Friday, according to reports from Fox 5 DC.  City...
title: Bowser leaves DC amid Trump takeover; returning Friday

author: Alix Martichoux
description: The long-awaited payouts from the record-breaking $725 million Facebook settlement are finally being sent out to the millions of users who qualified. Here's what you can expect.
title: Highly anticipated Facebook settlement checks will soon be sent to millions of users

author: Jonathan Easley
description: {beacon} PRESIDENT TRUMP and Russian President Vladimir Putin face a potentially a defining moment on the world stage when they arrive in Alaska on Friday for a bilateral summit, as Trump hopes to broker an end to Putin’s three-year war with Ukraine.   Trump and Putin are scheduled to meet at 3:30 p.m. Eastern time...
title: Trump, Putin face defining moment on Ukraine

author: Tara Suter
description: Pundit George Conway went after President Trump on Wednesday amid the president’s crackdown on crime in Washington, D.C. “What we have here isn’t traditional conservatism, it isn’t traditional Republicanism, it is authoritarianism,” Conway said on MSNBC’s “All In with Chris Hayes.” “But, I think a better word for it as I think about it, one...
title: George Conway slams Trump: ‘We don’t have Ronald Reagan anymore, we have Tony Soprano'

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Former National Security Adviser John Bolton on Wednesday said President Trump’s tariffs may push India further away from the U.S. and into deeper alliances with Russia and China. The president previously threatened to impose a 25 percent tariff on India for purchasing oil from the Kremlin absent of similar punishments for China, who purchases more...
title: Bolton: Trump tariffs may push India closer to Russia, China

author: David Guterson, opinion contributor
description: Employers who knowingly hire undocumented workers are rarely prosecuted, and the Homeland Security Department's Employment Eligibility Verification form is often used to avoid consequences, leaving 8.3 million undocumented workers in fear and limbo.
title: Our immigration laws let employers feign innocence

author: Jennie Murray, opinion contributor
description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers has introduced a bill to provide legal pathways for Afghans who supported U.S. forces, offering hope for Afghan allies living in the U.S. and the American community members who now call them neighbors and friends.
title: Bipartisan solutions for Afghan allies spark hope

author: Addy Bink
description: Video above: FDA announces in April 2025 that it will phase out food dyes. (NEXSTAR) — While several other food companies had confirmed they would drop artificial food dyes in response to a mission set forth by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. earlier this summer, Mars Wrigley was considered a holdout....
title: Mars says M&M's, Starbursts without synthetic dyes coming in 2026

author: Jacek Czaputowicz, opinion contributor
description: On the 105th anniversary of the Battle of Warsaw, President Trump and Vladimir Putin will meet in Alaska to discuss peace in Ukraine, marking a symbolic shift from the battle's defeat of Russian communism to the potential for cooperation between the two nations.
title: No matter its outcome, the meeting in Alaska will be a success for Vladimir Putin

author: Brittney Baird
description: About five people die from venomous snake bites each year in the U.S., according to an estimate from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
title: Hiker dies after venomous bite from 'most dangerous' snake in Tennessee

author: Cate Martel
description: Happy Thursday. Isn’t August recess glorious? 🌞 In today's issue: 🚓 IN WASHINGTON, DC The new militarized zone: President Trump’s Washington, D.C., takeover has begun. FBI Director Kash Patel said 45 arrests were made in the nation’s capital overnight. “29 immigration-related, 16 tied to the violent crime surge, and 3 firearm seizures,” Patel posted on...
title: Trump, DC residents face off in federal takeover

author: Anthony J. Principi, opinion contributor
description: Most favored nation pricing would unintentionally put these heroes, and generations of future service members, in harm's way.
title: Most favored nation pricing would undermine care for veterans

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin are set to meet in Alaska to discuss the ongoing war in Ukraine, with the hopes of brokering a peace deal and potentially earning Trump a Nobel Peace Prize.
title: What to know about base where Trump, Putin are meeting

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Director of National Intelligence (DNI) Tulsi Gabbard is going after her predecessor, pointing to a newly released email as part of her argument that there was an attempt by the Obama administration to undermine President Trump with their investigation of Russia’s 2016 election interference. A brief email exchange released by Gabbard shows a discussion between...
title: Gabbard goes after Clapper, declassifying emails on Russia hacking report

author: Addy Bink
description: A pair of massive data breaches impacted millions of customers, giving way to a $177 million settlement.
title: AT&T reached a $177M settlement over data breaches: Will you get a payment?

author: Marcela Escobari and Alex Brockwehl, opinion contributors
description: 79 percent of Americans now say immigration is a good thing for the country — a growing majority clearly believes U.S. policy should address immigration’s benefits, as well as its risks.
title: How to achieve the balanced immigration policy Americans want

author: Julia Shapero
description: WhatsApp, the highly popular messaging service owned by Meta, accused the Russian government Wednesday of trying to block its service.  “WhatsApp is private, end-to-end encrypted, and defies government attempts to violate people’s right to secure communication, which is why Russia is trying to block it from over 100 million Russian people,” the company said in...
title: WhatsApp accuses Russia of trying to block its service

author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: The settlement it accepts now will not only define this chapter of its history, but it will also set the terms for how — and whether — higher education in America can resist political retaliation in the decades to come.
title: Harvard, Trump deal will cause chilling effect if there are no safeguards

author: Alix Martichoux
description: The once-common practice of going back to school after Labor Day has grown rare in 2025. In fact, some schools have been back in session for weeks.
title: Back to school already? Why the academic year keeps getting shifted earlier

description: California Gov. title: Newsom announces 'Liberation Day' event in gerrymandering fight
